oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Assessment of goat colostrum quality and passive transfer
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: St. Clair, E. V.
Russell, R. W.
Van Saun, R. J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Colostrum
immunoglobulin passive transfer
goat colostrum quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Colostrum provides agammaglobulinemic newborns with immunity though immunoglobulin (IgG) passive transfer shortly after birth. Research on goat colostrum quality and passive transfer assessment is limited. Study objectives were to evaluate colostrum quality in goats defining a relationship between Brix reading and IgG concentration, document serum IgG concentration based on total IgG consumed, and determine a relationship between total protein and serum IgG concentrations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 405
